controller

Class MoveValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.MoveValidator

  • public class MoveValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    MoveValidator is a class with static methods to inspect board for check and checkmate scenarios
    Author:
    Danny Choi, Steven Barrios

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoveValidator() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.Boolean checkChecker(Board board, java.lang.String attackingColor)
      Checks board to see if any opposing color's piece can directly attack the player's King.
      static java.lang.Boolean checkmateChecker(Board board, java.lang.String defendingColor)
      Checks board to see if checkmate exists.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveValidator

        public MoveValidator()

    • Method Detail

      • checkChecker

        public static java.lang.Boolean checkChecker(Board board,
                                             java.lang.String attackingColor)
        Checks board to see if any opposing color's piece can directly attack the player's King.
        Parameters:
        board - game board
        attackingColor - attacking piece's color
        Returns:
        true if in check, false if not in check

      • checkmateChecker

        public static java.lang.Boolean checkmateChecker(Board board,
                                                 java.lang.String defendingColor)
        Checks board to see if checkmate exists.
        Parameters:
        board - game board
        defendingColor - defending piece's color
        Returns:
        true if in checkmate, false if not in checkmate
